a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Household air pollution deaths by region, 1990 to 2017
Annual number of premature deaths attributed to household air pollution from the use of solid fuels for cooking and
heating. Solid fuels includes the use of crop wastes, dung, charcoal and coal for indoor cooking.
Source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME)
